results.title: The Australian Royal Tours Collection 1901-1988
results.creator_credit: John Mandleberg, Film Australia and Aviva Ziegler
results.brief_description: A unique, visual cavalcade documenting the history of Australian tours by the British Royal Family since the turn of the century. It captures all the pomp and ceremony of the visits in the early 1900s by King George V, Edward the Prince of Wales and George VI, Queen Elizabeth’s first visit in 1954 and continues through to the younger generation of Royals with Diana and Fergie’s recent visits. Rated: G

results.title: The Australian plague locust
results.creator_credit: Howard Hughes, Department of Agriculture Film Unit and Broken Hill Proprietary Company
results.brief_description: The Australian Plague Locust, unique to Australia, is one of the major pests which attack crops, particularly in New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia. Discusses the characteristics of the locust, the reasons for plagues, and the efforts to predict and control outbreaks.

results.title: The Australian Outward Bound School
results.brief_description: The Outward Bound School on the Hawkesbury River is attended by young men of various backgrounds, from all parts of Australia and Papua New Guinea. Here they share many adventures - bushwalking, rock climbing and boating. Before participating in any expeditions they learn the fundamentals of map and compass reading, first aid and safety. The course is designed to teach self-discipline, give confidence, a sense of responsibility and achievement. Wholehearted participation in all activities prepares the boys to take their places in the community always remembering the Outward Bound motto - “To serve, to strive, and not to yield”. No credits available - donated by the Shell Company of Australia.

results.title: The Australian Opera favourites
results.brief_description: Presented by Peter Ross, this video brings together a popular selection of extracts from some of the world’s best operas. Highlights from the Australian Opera productions of ‘La Boheme’, ‘Il Trovatore’, ‘Tosca’, ‘A Masked ball’, ‘Lakme’, ‘La Traviata’, ‘The Merry widow’.

results.title: The Australian National University
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and John Morris
results.brief_description: Surveys the teaching and research facilities of the Australian National University. Shows examples of investigations being pursued in microbiology, botany, geophysics, English, law, archaeology, Indonesian, literature, zoology, demography, astronomy, and political science. Photography: Tom Cowan; Music: Moneta Eagles.

results.title: The Australian mallee
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
A study of the wildlife of the Victorian Mallee, a land of drifting sand and Mallee Scrub. Small animal life struggles for existence under these poor conditions, where rare waterholes mean life or death. The interesting Mallee Fowl which buries its eggs in incubating mounds, and mysteriously controls its heat; and the Bowerbird which builds a so-called bower for its mating display are shown, together with Wedgetailed eagles, kangaroos, ant lions, honeyeaters and Major Mitchell cockatoos. Photographed by Robert H. Clarke, narrated by Peter Wagner and devised by naturalist Graham Pizzey.

results.title: The Australian littering quest
results.creator_credit: Damien Parer, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Jack Zalkalns
results.brief_description: A satirical look at the four contestants hopeful of winning Australia’s littering quest. Describes the various ways they do their littering - including leaving rubbish at a picnic, throwing out “throw-away litter bags”. The judge, a computer, comments on their achievements and announces the winner. Cast includes Tom Paine, Pauline David, Rod Bryer, Guy Doro-Sainter, Monika Tokarski, Ema Ganet.
